recipe: One-pot sausage casserole with garlic breadcrumbs
name: One-pot sausage casserole with garlic breadcrumbs

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp sesame oil"},{"ingredients":"350g lean pork mince"},{"ingredients":"350g egg noodles"},{"ingredients":"thumb-sized piece ginger, peeled and chopped, or 1½ tbsp ginger purée"},{"ingredients":"3 garlic cloves, crushed, or 1 tbsp garlic purée"},{"ingredients":"320g stir-fry veg (we used 2 x 160g bags of mangetout, baby sweetcorn, beansprouts, carrots and peppers)"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp low-salt soy sauce"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp cornflour"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp sweet chilli sauce"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a wok or frying pan. Add the mince, break it up with a spoon and fry over a high heat for about 8 mins until browning. While the meat cooks, boil a kettle, then pour the hot water over the noodles. Set aside for 5-10 mins to soften."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Add the ginger, garlic and veg to the pan and stir-fry for 2-3 mins. Mix 1 tbsp soy sauce with the cornflour to make a paste. Add the remaining soy sauce, the chilli sauce and 2 tbsp water. Drain the noodles and add to the pan with the sauce. Cook until the sauce coats the noodles, adding a splash of water if needed, then serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp vegetable or rapeseed oil"},{"ingredients":"4 pork shoulder steaks (about 750g), cut into large chunks"},{"ingredients":"1 onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 leek, chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 carrot, chopped"},{"ingredients":"bundle of woody herbs (bouquet garni) – we used 2 bay leaves, 3 sage leaves and 4 thyme sprigs, plus a few thyme leaves to serve"},{"ingredients":"1 chicken stock cube"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp Dijon mustard"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp cider vinegar"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp cornflour"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp honey"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat your slow cooker. Drizzle the oil in a wide frying pan over a high heat. Season the pork, then add to the hot pan. Avoid overcrowding the meat – you may want to do this in batches. Cook until deep brown all over, then transfer to the slow cooker. Add the onion and leeks to the frying pan and cook for a few mins, until they soften. Add a splash of water and scrape any tasty bits from the bottom, then tip everything into the slow cooker. Add the carrot, herbs, stock cube, mustard and vinegar, season, then add enough water to just cover the ingredients. Stir, then set your slow cooker on low for 6-8 hrs, or high for 5-6 hrs."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"In a saucepan, mix the cornflour and honey with 1-2 tsp of liquid from the slow cooker, until you have a smooth paste. Add 100ml more liquid, bring to a simmer until thickened, then stir back into the casserole. Serve with mash or dumplings, scattered with thyme leaves."}]

recipe: Root veg & pancetta toad-in-the-hole with onion gravy
name: Root veg & pancetta toad-in-the-hole with onion gravy

recipe: Vegetarian bean pot with herby breadcrumbs
name: Vegetarian bean pot with herby breadcrumbs

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 shallots , finely chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp white wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"150ml white wine"},{"ingredients":"142ml pot  double cream"},{"ingredients":"900g fresh  haddock  fillets, skinned"},{"ingredients":"200g bag raw, peeled prawn , preferably unfrozen"},{"ingredients":"800g fresh  spinach  (about 2 bags)"},{"ingredients":"200g crabmeat"},{"ingredients":"3 garlic cloves"},{"ingredients":"1 red chilli , halved and deseeded"},{"ingredients":"200ml full-fat milk"},{"ingredients":"pinch saffron  strands"},{"ingredients":"1 ¼kg potato , cut into large chunks"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"zest and juice 1 lemon"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the shallots and vinegar into a saucepan and place on the heat so the vinegar evaporates quickly. Splash in the white wine and reduce until practically dry. Add cream, bring to the boil, then simmer gently until reduced by two-thirds and very thick. Leave to cool. Cut the fish into bite-size chunks and set aside with the prawns."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Tip spinach into a large colander and pour over boiling water from a kettle until all the spinach is wilted (you may need to do this more than once). Cool under the cold tap, then squeeze the spinach tightly to get rid of any excess liquid."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"To make the topping, mash the saffron, garlic and chilli together using a pestle and mortar. Tip into a saucepan with the milk, bring to the boil, then remove from the heat to infuse. Bring the potatoes to the boil and simmer for 15 mins until soft. Drain, then mash well with the infused milk, olive oil, lemon juice and zest."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Heat oven to 200C/fan 180C/gas 6. To assemble the pie, mix the fish and prawns into the cold cream until completely coated. Tip the fish into the bottom of a large gratin dish and scatter over clumps of crabmeat. Unravel the spinach and lay it over the fish, then top with the mash. Cook the pie for about 30 mins until golden and starting to brown and bubble around the edges. Serve with green veg if you like."}]

recipe: White velvet soup with smoky almonds
name: White velvet soup with smoky almonds

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"a little butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"2 thick slices good  white bread"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp fig jam"},{"ingredients":"2 tsp Dijon mustard"},{"ingredients":"few slices brie or camembert"},{"ingredients":"1 thick slice of ham (best from the deli counter, or leftover)"},{"ingredients":"salad leaves , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat a toastie maker or a small griddle pan. Butter each slice of bread on one side, then spread the other side of one slice with fig jam, and one with mustard. Top the fig jam with brie and ham, sandwich with the remaining bread, butter-side up, then place in the toastie maker or the griddle pan. If cooking in a pan, squash down a little with the back of a fish slice while cooking, flip over after 2-3 mins when golden, then cook on the other side. Serve with a handful of salad leaves on the side, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"300g leek, halved and finely sliced"},{"ingredients":"8 rashers smoked streaky bacon, sliced"},{"ingredients":"400g pasta shapes (we used penne)"},{"ingredients":"100g herb & garlic soft cheese (we used Boursin)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan. Add the leeks and 2 tbsp water, and cook for about 10 mins until very soft. Add the bacon, turn up the heat and fry until cooked."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Meanwhile, cook the pasta following pack instructions. Drain and reserve a mug of the cooking water."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Spoon cheese into the leek and bacon mix, adding some of the reserved cooking water. Season and stir gently over a low heat until melted. Toss through the cooked pasta, adding a little more cooking water, if needed, to help the sauce coat the pasta."}]

recipe: Guinea fowl tagine with chickpeas, squash & apricots
name: Guinea fowl tagine with chickpeas, squash & apricots

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"200g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"½ tsp ground  cardamom (about 10 pods, ground)"},{"ingredients":"25g butter"},{"ingredients":"25g light muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 egg"},{"ingredients":"about  milk"},{"ingredients":"butter and a honeycomb or jar of honey, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Put the flour and cardamom in a bowl and rub in the butter. Add sugar. Beat the egg in a measuring jug, then pour in milk to make it up to 100ml/3½fl oz. Pour into the bowl gradually, stirring first with a knife then with your hands, to make a soft, not sticky, dough. Knead until smooth on a floured work surface."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Divide the dough into three and roll into circles the thickness of a £1 coin. Cut each into quarters. Heat a heavy-bottomed frying pan to medium hot. Cook the scones in batches for a couple of mins each side, until golden brown. Serve, spread with butter and drizzled with honey."}]

recipe: Ultimate toad-in-the-hole with caramelised onion gravy
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"140g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"4 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"300ml semi-skimmed milk"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp wholegrain mustard"},{"ingredients":"handful of woody herbs, leaves picked and chopped (we used 6 sage leaves, 4 rosemary sprigs and 4 thyme sprigs), plus a handful, fried until crispy, to serve (optional)"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"8 rashers smoked streaky bacon"},{"ingredients":"8 fat sausages (we used Cumberland but use your favourite variety)"},{"ingredients":"2 red onions, cut into wedges"},{"ingredients":"cooked green vegetables (optional), to serve"},{"ingredients":"mash (optional), to serve"},{"ingredients":"drizzle of sunflower oil"},{"ingredients":"2 red onions , halved and thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp balsamic vinegar"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"250ml red wine"},{"ingredients":"500ml chicken or beef stock"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Tip the flour into a large jug or bowl. Crack in the eggs, one at a time, whisking as you do. Pour in the milk and continue whisking until you have a smooth, lump-free batter. Add the mustard, herbs and some seasoning, then cover and set aside for 2 hrs, or chill overnight."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 7. Heat the oil in a large metal roasting tin or enamel baking dish, roughly 30 x 22cm, with high-ish sides. Wrap a rasher of bacon around each sausage and pop them in the dish with the onion wedges. Place on the middle shelf of the oven (make sure the top shelf is removed to allow space for the batter to rise later). Cook for 15-20 mins until the sausages and bacon are browning and sizzling."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, make the gravy. Drizzle a little oil into a saucepan. Add the sliced onions and cook slowly for 15 mins. Stir every now and then until they are soft and caramelised. Add the sugar and balsamic vinegar, and cook for 5 mins more until sticky."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"The batter should be the consistency of double cream - if it has become a little thick, add a splash of cold water. Take the batter to the oven, open the door, carefully pull out the shelf and quickly pour the batter around the sausages. Close the oven and do not open it again for at least 25 mins."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"To finish the gravy, stir the flour into the onions to make a paste, cooking for 1-2 mins. Continue stirring while you splash in the wine, a little at a time, until you have a smooth, thick sauce. Increase the heat and bubble for a few mins until reduced by about half. Add the stock and some seasoning, and continue bubbling for 10 mins while the toad cooks."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"By now the toad should be puffed up and deep golden brown. If not, continue cooking - but don't open the oven as it will sink. Serve scattered with the crisp herbs (if using), with the gravy, green veg, and mash, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g butter , softened, plus extra for the dish"},{"ingredients":"5 tbsp golden syrup"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp honey"},{"ingredients":"8 fresh figs"},{"ingredients":"4 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"250g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"250g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla extract"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp full-fat Greek yogurt"},{"ingredients":"2-3 thyme sprigs (optional)"},{"ingredients":"extra virgin olive oil or honey, for drizzling (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter a 20 x 22cm ovenproof dish, then pour in the golden syrup and honey. Trim the stalks from the figs, then cut a deep cross in the top, just so they open out a bit, but be careful not to cut all the way through. Sit the figs upright on top of the syrup and put them in the oven to bake for 15-20 mins until softened and starting to caramelise a little at the edges."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"While the figs are cooking, make the sponge mixture. Put the eggs, sugar, flour, baking powder, vanilla and butter in a bowl and use an electric whisk to beat until smooth."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Remove the dish from the oven, scoop the figs out with a slotted spoon and set aside. Once the syrup mixture has cooled in the dish, take spoonfuls of the sponge batter and gently place them on top of the syrup. It’s best to do this all the way around the edge first, then end in the middle – this helps keep the syrup mixture separate. Smooth the batter out very gently to cover any gaps and seal the syrup mixture in."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Bake for 35-40 mins or until the sponge springs back when pressed. Allow to cool for around 5 mins or until just warm, then seconds before serving, dot the surface with eight small dollops of the yogurt. Top each mound with a baked fig, then scatter over some thyme leaves and drizzle with extra virgin olive oil, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g unsalted butter , cubed, plus extra for the tin"},{"ingredients":"3 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"275g light brown soft sugar"},{"ingredients":"25g dark brown muscovado sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp vanilla bean paste"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp fine sea salt"},{"ingredients":"200g plain flour"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp baking powder"},{"ingredients":"100g dried pears , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"100g dark chocolate , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp caramel , from a can or jar"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Butter and line a 20 x 20cm square cake tin."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Melt the butter in a saucepan over a medium heat, swirling it around. Allow to bubble for a few minutes, or until it turns a light golden brown and smells biscuity. Remove from the heat and leave to cool a little."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Tip the eggs into a large mixing bowl and whisk together with the light and dark sugars until just combined. Whisk through the melted butter, vanilla and salt."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Gently fold through the flour, baking powder, dried pears and most of the chocolate chunks, being careful not to overmix (this will make the blondies dense)."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Pour the mixture into the lined tin. Top with the remaining chocolate and dollops of the caramel. Put in the centre of the oven to bake for 40 mins, or until a skewer inserted comes out with sticky crumbs (it shouldn’t be wet). Leave to cool completely in the tin. It will sink a little – the centre should be slightly squidgy. Cut into 12 squares. Will keep in an airtight container for up to three days."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"2 x 425g cans pitted black cherries , in syrup"},{"ingredients":"6 tbsp cherry  jam"},{"ingredients":"200g butter , softened"},{"ingredients":"200g golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"3 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"50g self-raising flour"},{"ingredients":"140g ground almond"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp almond extract"},{"ingredients":"50g flaked almond"},{"ingredients":"icing sugar , for dusting"},{"ingredients":"cream or custard , to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 180C/160C fan/gas 4. Tip the syrup from the cherries and the jam into a saucepan. Boil for 10-15 mins until the liquid has reduced by half and is thick and syrupy, and add the cherries to the pan. Pour into a baking dish, roughly 18 x 25cm, then set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"In a large bowl, mix the butter, sugar, eggs, flour, almonds, almond extract and a pinch of salt with an electric whisk until combined. Dollop the sponge mixture over the cherries and spread to a smooth layer, trying not to disturb the cherries underneath too much. Scatter over the flaked almonds, then bake for 45 mins until a skewer inserted into the sponge layer comes out clean. Leave to cool for 5 mins, then dust with icing sugar and serve with cream or, better yet, custard."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"100g mini cooking chorizo , skins removed"},{"ingredients":"3 pork sausages , squeezed from their skins"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp smoked paprika"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp lime juice , plus wedges to serve"},{"ingredients":"small bunch coriander , chopped"},{"ingredients":"½ x 400g can mixed beans , drained and rinsed"},{"ingredients":"1 medium egg , lightly whisked"},{"ingredients":"1 ½ tbsp olive oil , plus extra to drizzle"},{"ingredients":"2 ciabatta rolls, split and toasted"},{"ingredients":"soured cream, avocado, small handful rocket and  chips , to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"In a food processor, pulse the chorizo, sausagemeat, paprika, lime juice and coriander until well combined. Add the beans and some seasoning, and quickly pulse again to mix. Tip into a bowl and mix in just enough egg (about half) to bind. Shape into 2 fat burgers, cover and chill for 15 mins. Meanwhile, heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a pan and fry the burgers for 3 mins on each side. Transfer to a baking sheet and cook in the oven for a further 10 mins until cooked through."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Serve the burgers in rolls with soured cream, avocado and rocket, with chips and lime wedges on the side, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves, crushed"},{"ingredients":"500g lean lamb mince"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground cinnamon"},{"ingredients":"1 beef or lamb stock cube"},{"ingredients":"2 x 400g cans chopped tomatoes"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp dried oregano"},{"ingredients":"400g macaroni"},{"ingredients":"250g tub ricotta"},{"ingredients":"50g parmesan, grated"},{"ingredients":"50ml milk"},{"ingredients":"garlic bread, to serve (optional)"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large pan, add the onion and cook for 10 mins until soft. Add the garlic and cook for 1 min more, then tip in the lamb mince, turn up the heat and brown, breaking up the mince with a wooden spoon."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Once the lamb is browned, add the cinnamon, crumbled stock cube, tomatoes and oregano. Stir well and simmer for 15 mins, covered, then for 15 mins, uncovered, until the sauce has thickened and the tomatoes have cooked down."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Meanwhile, cook the macaroni following pack instructions. Drain well. Heat oven to 200C/180C fan/gas 6."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Mix together the ricotta, most of the parmesan and the milk with plenty of seasoning, and stir into the macaroni. Tip the mince into a large baking dish, top with the macaroni mixture, and scatter over the remaining parmesan. Bake for 30 mins until golden and bubbling. Serve hot with garlic bread, if you like."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"500g small elbow macaroni"},{"ingredients":"80g butter , plus extra for tossing through the pasta"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp plain flour"},{"ingredients":"600ml whole milk"},{"ingredients":"170g can evaporated milk"},{"ingredients":"700g extra mature cheddar , 500g coarsely grated, 200g chopped into small chunks"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp mustard powder"},{"ingredients":"large pinch cayenne pepper"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Marmite"},{"ingredients":"splash of malt, cider or red wine vinegar"},{"ingredients":"50g grated parmesan (or vegetarian alternative)"},{"ingredients":"50g fresh white breadcrumbs"},{"ingredients":"50g panko breadcrumbs"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat oven to 220C/200C fan/gas 8. Cook the macaroni in salted water for 2 mins less than the stated cooking time, so it still has plenty of bite. Drain well and toss with a small knob of the butter to stop it from sticking together."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, heat the remaining butter until frothy and nut-brown. Pour off 1 tbsp into a small bowl and place the pan back on the heat, then scatter over and whisk in the flour and cook for 3 mins until you have a sandy paste. Add the milk, a splash at a time, simmering and whisking until smooth between each addition. Once all the milk has been added, drizzle in the evaporated milk, then add the grated cheddar, a handful at a time, until you have a thick, cheesy sauce. Stir through the mustard powder, cayenne, Marmite and vinegar and taste for seasoning, adding salt and pepper as needed."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Remove from heat, stir in the macaroni, then stir through the chunks of cheese. Tip the contents of the saucepan into a large, buttered baking dish. In a small bowl, mix together all the breadcrumbs, the parmesan, another small pinch of cayenne and some crunchy sea salt if you want. Scatter the crumbs over the macaroni, drizzle with the reserved brown butter and bake for 30-35 mins until lightly browned, crunchy all over and bubbling around the edges. Leave to stand for 10 mins before serving straight from the dish."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"250g plain flour, plus extra for rolling"},{"ingredients":"140g cold unsalted butter, roughly cubed"},{"ingredients":"1 large egg yolk"},{"ingredients":"1 small egg whisked with 1 tbsp milk, for the egg wash"},{"ingredients":"1 ox kidney, about 400g/14oz, get it fresh from your butcher. Pig's and lamb's kidneys aren't suitable as they only need short cooking"},{"ingredients":"1kg trimmed British top rump beef"},{"ingredients":"250g flat mushrooms, unpeeled but wiped with a damp cloth"},{"ingredients":"3 tbsp groundnut or vegetable oil"},{"ingredients":"100g unsalted butter"},{"ingredients":"1 large onion, peeled and thickly chopped"},{"ingredients":"50-85g plain flour, depending on how thick you like your gravy"},{"ingredients":"600ml off-the-boil water"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp Marigold Swiss vegetable bouillon powder"},{"ingredients":"1 large bay leaf"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"It's important to cook the meat a day ahead, so that you can discard any fat that has risen to the top, and so that the pastry doesn't slump in the face of a too-warm filling, so up to 48 hours ahead -make the pastry. Whizz the flour and a pinch of fine sea salt together for a few seconds in a food processor, then add the butter and whizz until the mixture looks like coarse breadcrumbs. Whisk together the egg yolk and 3 tbsp water and whizz with the pastry until it collects in a ball. Wrap in cling film and leave it to rest in the fridge for at least one hour."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Cut button-mushroom-sized lobes of kidney from the white central core (discarding). Cut the beef into bite-sized cubes and cut the mushrooms into chunks."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Heat 1 tbsp of the oil in a large, heavy frying pan over a medium-high heat. Throw in the kidney and fry until lightly coloured. Tip into a colander to drain."},{"method":"STEP 4"},{"method":"Wipe out the frying pan and return it to a low-medium heat, adding 25g/1oz of the butter and 1 tbsp oil. Tip in the onion and fry for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until soft and slightly golden. Transfer to a large casserole, using a slotted spoon."},{"method":"STEP 5"},{"method":"Preheat the oven to 160C/gas 3/fan 140C. Tip the 85g/3oz flour into a large plastic bag, and season it generously. Throw in the beef and shake until lightly floured.Return the frying pan to a mediumhigh heat, adding a little more oil and butter if needed. Shake off any excess flour (reserving it) then fry the beef in batches until golden-brown. As each batch is done, transfer it to the casserole."},{"method":"STEP 6"},{"method":"Adding more oil and butter to the frying pan if necessary, fry the mushrooms for about 2 minutes until starting to wilt, then add them to the casserole with the drained kidneys, hot water, bouillon powder and bay leaf, plus the excess flour in the bag if you like a thick gravy. Stir well, cover and cook in the oven for 75-90 minutes until the meat is tender and the sauce is thick. Cool thoroughly, then put in the fridge (preferably overnight) so any fat will solidify – it can then be skimmed off and discarded."},{"method":"STEP 7"},{"method":"In the morning - return the pastry to cool room temperature, then roll it out thinly on a wellfloured surface. Invert a 28-30x23cm, 6.5cm deep pie dish on to the pastry. Mentally add an extra 1cm all round, then use the dish as a guide to cut out the pastry lid. From the remnants, cut out enough 6cm-wide strips of pastry to go round the dish – they should cover the flat rim and about halfway down the insides."},{"method":"STEP 8"},{"method":"Lightly butter the rim of the dish and line it with the strip(s) of pastry, sealing any joins with a little dab of water. Butter the shoulders of a pie raiser or an upturned egg cup and stand it in the middle. Spoon in the meat mixture to come level with the top of the dish. Don’t overfill: reserve any excess gravy to serve hot with the pie."},{"method":"STEP 9"},{"method":"Brush the pastry rim with a little water, then drape the pastry lid over it, pinching the edges to seal. Cover with cling film and keep in the fridge if not baking immediately."},{"method":"STEP 10"},{"method":"Finally, an hour before serving - preheat the oven to 200C/gas 6/fan 180C. Make four slashes in the lid of the pie, then brush with the egg wash. Bake for 35-45 minutes until the pastry is golden brown, turning the heat down 10-20° after about 20 minutes. Remove the pie from the oven and leave it to rest for around 10 minutes before cutting into it."}]

recipe: Guinea fowl tagine with chickpeas, squash & apricots
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"3 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"2 guinea fowl , jointed like a chicken (ask your butcher to do this or see our video on how to joint a chicken, in 'Try', below)"},{"ingredients":"2 onions , roughly chopped"},{"ingredients":"2 garlic cloves , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 butternut squash or small pumpkin, peeled, deseeded and cut into large chunks"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp ras-el-hanout"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground cumin"},{"ingredients":"1 tsp ground coriander"},{"ingredients":"¼ tsp ground ginger"},{"ingredients":"1 large  cinnamon stick"},{"ingredients":"small squeeze of  clear honey"},{"ingredients":"large pinch of  saffron , soaked in 1 tbsp boiling water"},{"ingredients":"juice 1  lemon"},{"ingredients":"850ml chicken stock"},{"ingredients":"400g can chickpea , drained and rinsed"},{"ingredients":"200g dried apricot"},{"ingredients":"small bunch coriander"},{"ingredients":"couscous or rice, to serve"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Heat the oil in a large, shallow flameproof casserole dish. Season the guinea fowl pieces and brown them – in batches, if necessary – then remove to a plate."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Fry the onions in the same dish until softened, then add the garlic and squash, cooking for 1-2 mins. Tip in the spices and cook for a few mins before adding the honey, saffron and lemon juice. Pour in the chicken stock and the chickpeas."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Submerge the guinea fowl pieces in the stock and add the apricots. Cover the dish and simmer everything very gently for 50 mins-1 hr, until the fowl and squash are both tender. Stir through the coriander and serve with couscous or rice."}]

recipe: Vegetarian bean pot with herby breadcrumbs
ingredients: [{"ingredients":"1 slice crusty bread"},{"ingredients":"½ small pack parsley leaves"},{"ingredients":"½ lemon , zested"},{"ingredients":"2 tbsp olive oil"},{"ingredients":"pinch chilli flakes (optional)"},{"ingredients":"2 leeks , rinsed and chopped into half-moons"},{"ingredients":"2 carrots , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 celery sticks , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"1 fennel bulb , thinly sliced"},{"ingredients":"2 large garlic cloves , chopped"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp tomato purée"},{"ingredients":"few thyme sprigs"},{"ingredients":"150ml white wine"},{"ingredients":"400g can cannellini beans , drained"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Toast the bread, then tear into pieces and put in a food processor with the parsley, lemon zest, ½ tbsp olive oil, a good pinch of salt and pepper and the chilli flakes, if using. Blitz to breadcrumbs. Set aside."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Heat the remaining oil in a pan and add the leeks, carrots, celery and fennel along with a splash of water and a pinch of salt. Cook over a medium heat for 10 mins until soft, then add the garlic and tomato purée. Cook for 1 min more, then add the thyme and white wine. Leave to bubble for a minute, then add the beans. Fill the can halfway with water and pour into the pot."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Bring the cassoulet to the boil, then turn down the heat and leave to simmer for 15 mins before removing the thyme sprigs. Mash half the beans to thicken the stew. Season to taste, then divide between bowls and top with the herby breadcrumbs to serve."}]

ingredients: [{"ingredients":"8 slices day-old crusty white bread , crusts removed"},{"ingredients":"50g very soft butter"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp Seville orange marmalade , plus 4 tsp"},{"ingredients":"300ml full-fat milk"},{"ingredients":"248ml pot double cream"},{"ingredients":"3 large eggs"},{"ingredients":"seeds 1 vanilla pod"},{"ingredients":"4 tbsp golden caster sugar"},{"ingredients":"1 tbsp whisky"},{"ingredients":"icing sugar , for dusting"}]
method: [{"method":"STEP 1"},{"method":"Butter each piece of bread on both sides, then spread 4 with the 1 tbsp marmalade each. Pop the remaining bread on top to make 4 marmalade sandwiches. Cut into triangles and nestle in rows in a large baking dish. Heat oven to 160C/140C fan/gas 3."},{"method":"STEP 2"},{"method":"Beat the milk, cream, eggs, vanilla, sugar and whisky together, then pour over the bread. Leave to soak for 30 mins."},{"method":"STEP 3"},{"method":"Dot the remaining marmalade all over the top of the pud and dust with the icing sugar. Bake for 45 mins-1 hr or until puffy and starting to caramelise where the bread breaks out of the custard. Serve hot or warm."}]
